text.tspan: 𝐒𝐮𝐦𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐲:
ƒ: These are Gulden, they can be used to buy
Upgrades and Provinces in the Main Menu. For
each difficulty, there is a seperate Upgrade Route,
so make sure you're playing in the Mode you've
spend your Gulden in! (Bought Provinces on the
other hand, can be played in each Difficulty!)
"Information": can only be used to see the Stats
of the selected Province, while "Diplomacy" can be
used to Fight / Befriend the selected Province,
which takes up your "Action Points"!
"Next turn": can be used to regain "Action Points",
but also increases "Rebel Strength" (Which on Full
Power will cause a Rebellion in your last Province!)
"Enter Town": can be used to either increase your
Army or buy new Islands which earn tax-per-turn!
Battles: decrease "Rebel Strength" upon Difficulty!
Total # of allies determines your allied tax income!
3x enemy army required to make one surrender!
Turn on auto firing with the switch during battles!
If you find any bugs/glitches, plz contact @Ojee07!
𝐓𝐮𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐢𝐚𝐥:
To start off, it is highly recommended to play the
game on easy mode at first. Without upgrades, the
harder modes might seem impossible! Each difficulty
has its own upgrade budget, meaning upgrades
bought in one difficulty do not carry over to another.
When you start the game for the first time, the
difficulty is set to easy mode, with some pre-given
upgrades to help you get started. You will also begin
with 1 to 3 of the first Provinces. The main game uses
a large map of the Netherlands, featuring multiple
provinces that can be selected by clicking on them.
When a province is selected, it will appear in a darker
shade. At the bottom of the screen, there are multiple
buttons, each with a different function. Their uses are
explained in the Summary! In the game, you can
choose to form alliances, buy colonies, and engage
in other activities. However, these features are optional.
The primary objective is to build and use your army to
conquer all other provinces! The functions of these
additional features are also covered in the Summary.
Still, the best way to learn how the game works is
through practice! I suggest trying it out with the first
upgrades in easy mode to explore the mechanics for
yourself. Keep in mind that features may change in
the future, as the game continues to receive updates!
